thread.title: Disney revamps pass system, raises prices
thread.title_full: Disney revamps pass system, raises prices

author: Sandra Pedicini
title: Disney revamps pass system, raises prices
text:
Disney revamps pass system, raises prices Orlando News Now: Disney revamps pass system, raises prices 
Walt Disney World revamped its annual and seasonal pass system. 
Walt Disney World revamped its annual and seasonal pass system. New Disney passes cost $389 for seasonal, $649 for annual 
Walt Disney World revamped its annual and seasonal pass system Sunday. 
Among the major changes: Prices have increased, though Disney points out passes also include new benefits. Also, Disney now sells two passes with blackout dates, with the pricier one allowing people to visit more days. 
The cost of parking has increased,too, from $17 to $20. 
The new system "has been designed to offer a wider variety of options and entitlements to best fit the needs of our Passholders," Disney said in an email to customers Sunday. 
The $329 seasonal pass is now gone. Instead there are gold and silver passes. 
The silver pass, for Florida residents only, costs $389. It has blackout dates during summer, Christmastime and spring break. Disney breaks $100 ticket barrier, Universal follows suit Disney announced its one-day Magic Kingdom ticket price has increased to $105. Universal followed suit announcing its one-day ticket price also breaks the $100 barrier. Disney announced its one-day Magic Kingdom ticket price has increased to $105. Universal followed suit announcing its one-day ticket price also breaks the $100 barrier. See more videos 
The gold pass costs $549 and allows summertime visitation but has blackout dates during Christmas and spring break. The pass, allowing visits about 335 days of the year, is for Florida residents and Disney Vacation Club members only. 
Unlike the previous seasonal passes, the gold and silver passes include free parking. The gold one includes PhotoPass downloads. 
The Epcot After 4 and Weekday Select passes, for Florida residents only, also now offer free parking,as well. 
The most expensive "platinum plus" pass costs $729 for Florida residents and $829 for out-of-state tourists. It provides admission to four WaltDisney World theme parks, two water parks, Disney's Oak Trail Golf Course, and ESPN Wide World of Sports. It also includes unlimited Disney PhotoPass downloads and special offers for stays at Disney hotels. 
Dashingly-dressed Disney fans at Hollywood Studios for Dapper Day on Saturday October 3, 2015. 
Previously the highest-level pass had cost $649 for Florida residents. 
The regular annual pass, called a Disney Platinum Pass, now costs $649 for Florida residents and $749 for out-of-state tourists. It now includes Disney Photo Pass downloads. 
Previously, an annual pass had cost $529 for Florida residents. 
Current passes remain valid through their expiration dates. 
Passes were also revamped at Disneyland, including the introduction of one pass costing more than $1,000.
